title: Overview Tab
text: To make any changes click Edit this will open the form up for changes. Tenant Details K3 Customer Name This should be the Tenants name K3 references them by. K3 Customer Number This is the id number used by K3 for the tenant. K3 Business Unit Refers to a specific division or segment within the larger organization of K3 ERP System This should be the name of the system the tenant uses. Expires xx/xx/xxxx This is the date the Tenant will expire. Billable If this tenant is billable this should be checked. Log Rocket Enabled This flag when enabled helps to collect K3 user sessions within Imagine and the Companion App which will aid in helping to fix issues and further development. Active This if check marked will activate the Tenant.
description:
To make any changes click Edit this will open the form up for changes.


Tenant Details
K3 Customer NameThis should be the Tenants name K3 references them by.
K3 Customer NumberThis is the id number used by K3 for the tenant.
K3 Business UnitRefers to a specific division or segment within the larger organization of K3
ERP SystemThis should be the name of the system the tenant uses.
Expires xx/xx/xxxxThis is the date the Tenant will expire.
BillableIf this tenant is billable this should be checked.
Log Rocket EnabledThis flag when enabled helps to collect K3 user sessions within Imagine and the Companion App which will aid in helping to fix issues and further development.
ActiveThis if check marked will activate the Tenant.

title: Users Tab
text: The Users Tab is where you can manage or add multiple users within your tenant. Adding a New User 1. Click "New User". 2. Fill in the fields with the User information any field marked with an * is required. 3. Assign Modules: Click the modules you want the user to have access to they will move to the top and become blue. To remove a module click the x in the top right when you hover over the icon. NOTE: Certain modules have a "cog" icon this is to assign specific shops. Click the icon and using the drop-down select the required shop. 4. Personal Access Token: These are the tokens that are created via Personal Access Tokens via the Tenant, any that have been created wil be shown below. 5. Once you are happy with the filled in information and assigned modules click "Save". Clicking "Reset" once will reset the modules, a second click will complelty clear the form. Clicking "back" will not save any changes and return you to the user list.
description:
The Users Tab is where you can manage or add multiple users within your tenant. 


Adding a New User

1. Click "New User".



2. Fill in the fields with the User information any field marked with an * is required. 



3.  Assign Modules: Click the modules you want the user to have access to they will move to the top and become blue. 

To remove a module click the x in the top right when you hover over the icon. 

NOTE: Certain modules have a "cog" icon this is to assign specific shops. Click the icon and using the drop-down select the required shop.



4. Personal Access Token: These are the tokens that are created via Personal Access Tokens via the Tenant, any that have been created wil be shown below. 

5. Once you are happy with the filled in information and assigned modules click "Save".

  • Clicking "Reset" once will reset the modules, a second click will complelty clear the form.
  • Clicking "back" will not save any changes and return you to the user list.

title: Widgets Tab
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Adding Multiple Widgets to Shops. Adding a Single Widget to a Shop. Deleting a Widget Rearranging Widgets The Widgets Tab is where you can enable specific functionalities for select shops. Adding Multiple Widgets to Shops. STEP 1: On the left-hand side of each corresponding shop, you can find a checkbox. To apply the widgets, simply select the shops you want by checking the box. It's worth noting that you can add widgets to multiple shops simultaneously. Step 2: Please use the checkboxes to select the "Widgets" you want to apply from the drop-down menu. Step 3: Once you have chosen the desired widgets and shops, simply click the "Apply" button. You will receive a notification once the process is complete, confirming the changes. Adding a Single Widget to a Shop. Step 1: You also can add a single-line Widget to a shop by using the "+" icon shown in the Assigned Widgets section. Step 2: Select the widget you wish to add from the drop-down that appears. Step 3: After selecting the widget, click on the "Save" icon located on the right side. If you have chosen the wrong widget by mistake and need to start over, you can use the "undo arrow" icon. Deleting a Widget Step 1: To remove any previously applied Widget you can use the "Bin" icon located next to the widget you wish to remove. Step 2: To fully remove the widget, you must confirm the deletion by clicking the "Yes" option on the pop-up window. Step 3: Once completed, a notification will appear confirming that the widget has been successfully removed. Rearranging Widgets You can rearrange the order of the widgets as per your preference. To do so, click on the six dots on the widget and drag it to the desired position before dropping it into place.
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Adding Multiple Widgets to Shops.
  • Adding a Single Widget to a Shop.
  • Deleting a Widget
  • Rearranging Widgets


The Widgets Tab is where you can enable specific functionalities for select shops.


Adding Multiple Widgets to Shops.

STEP 1: On the left-hand side of each corresponding shop, you can find a checkbox. To apply the widgets, simply select the shops you want by checking the box. It's worth noting that you can add widgets to multiple shops simultaneously.



Step 2: Please use the checkboxes to select the "Widgets" you want to apply from the drop-down menu.



Step 3: Once you have chosen the desired widgets and shops, simply click the "Apply" button. You will receive a notification once the process is complete, confirming the changes.



Adding a Single Widget to a Shop.

Step 1: You also can add a single-line Widget to a shop by using the "+" icon shown in the Assigned Widgets section.



Step 2: Select the widget you wish to add from the drop-down that appears. 



Step 3: After selecting the widget, click on the "Save" icon located on the right side. If you have chosen the wrong widget by mistake and need to start over, you can use the "undo arrow" icon.



Deleting a Widget

Step 1: To remove any previously applied Widget you can use the "Bin" icon located next to the widget you wish to remove. 



Step 2: To fully remove the widget, you must confirm the deletion by clicking the "Yes" option on the pop-up window.



Step 3: Once completed, a notification will appear confirming that the widget has been successfully removed.



Rearranging Widgets

You can rearrange the order of the widgets as per your preference. To do so, click on the six dots on the widget and drag it to the desired position before dropping it into place.

title: Connectors
text: The Connectors tab displays the connectors assigned to your tenant. From this section, you can efficiently manage the connectors by performing actions such as remote resetting or updating them. To proceed, please click on the "Choose Command" button and select the desired command from the provided list. After selecting the desired command, the window will automatically close. Next, please select the connector(s) that you want to be affected by using the checkboxes provided in the list. After selecting the desired connector(s) using the checkboxes, please proceed by clicking the "Execute Command" button corresponding to the chosen command.
description:
The Connectors tab displays the connectors assigned to your tenant. From this section, you can efficiently manage the connectors by performing actions such as remote resetting or updating them.



To proceed, please click on the "Choose Command" button and select the desired command from the provided list.


 

After selecting the desired command, the window will automatically close. Next, please select the connector(s) that you want to be affected by using the checkboxes provided in the list.



After selecting the desired connector(s) using the checkboxes, please proceed by clicking the "Execute Command" button corresponding to the chosen command.

title: Shop Features
text: Shop features are where you add which functionalities you want for your tenant. Using the drop-down select a store from the list. You will see listed Shop Features on this page if already added and listed in the table. You can add Shop Features using the drop-down "Select Shop Features Template" Select which features you wish to add by checking the boxes, you can add multiple. Once selected click the "Apply" button, it will then be added to the list. You can edit or remove previously added Shop Features. Edit the Shop Features Save Changes Undo / Cancel Changes Deletes/ removes the Shop Feature, a pop-up will appear. Clicking "Yes" will delete the feature, while selecting "No" will cancel the deletion.
description:
Shop features are where you add which functionalities you want for your tenant. 


Using the drop-down select a store from the list.



You will see listed Shop Features on this page if already added and listed in the table. 



You can add Shop Features using the drop-down "Select Shop Features Template"

 

Select which features you wish to add by checking the boxes, you can add multiple. 



Once selected click the "Apply" button, it will then be added to the list. 



You can edit or remove previously added Shop Features.



 

Edit the Shop Features
Save Changes
Undo / Cancel Changes
Deletes/ removes the Shop Feature, a pop-up will appear. Clicking "Yes" will delete the feature, while selecting "No" will cancel the deletion.
